feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued November 28 at 6:26AM AKST until November 29 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 40 mph with gusts up to 75 mph expected. * WHERE...North Slopes of the Western Alaska Range. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Slopes of the Western Alaska Range

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 5:58AM AKST until November 29 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches in most areas, with up to 6 inches along the Nulato Hills. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. There is a chance of

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 5:58AM AKST until November 29 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow, with low visibility possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. There is a chance of freezing rain this afternoon as well.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued November 28 at 5:58AM AKST until November 29 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 3 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches, with up to 7 inches along the Nulato Hills and near Kaltag. Winds gusting to 30 mph with blowing snow and visibility one half mile or less at times.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 5:58AM AKST until November 29 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting to 35 mph. * WHERE...Lower Koyukuk Valley.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 5:58AM AKST until November 29 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Upper Kobuk Valleys.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 5:31AM AKST until November 29 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Visibility one half mile or less at times. South winds gusting to 40 mph. * WHERE...Central Brooks Range.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 5:27AM AKST until November 28 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Visibility one half mile or less in blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River.
entry.cap:areaDesc: White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 4:40AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG AND GUSTY SOUTHEAST WINDS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... Gusty southeast winds will affect a large portion of Southcentral today, from the Kenai Peninsula to Anchorage, the Matanuska Valley, and the southern to western Susitna Valley. Winds will gradually increase this morning, then peak this afternoon and evening. Winds will then diminish overnight tonight through
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued November 28 at 1:45PM CST until November 30 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 55 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Thursday afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 2:28PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow showers with embedded snow squalls may impact the evening commute in northeastern New York and Vermont... Snow squalls are possible late this afternoon in the heaviest showers as a cold front moves across Vermont. Affected locations will see rapidly changing weather and road conditions...with brief heavy snow and gusty winds. Visibilities below 1 mile are expected
entry.cap:areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Grand Isle; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin; Western Rutland; Western Windsor

entry.summary: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho and Central, East Central, North Central, and Northeast Washington. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PST Thursday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 8:06AM EST until November 28 at 4:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of one to three inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant County.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued November 28 at 12:29AM MST until November 28 at 2:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. Areas of blowing snow reducing visibility to under a mile for areas with recent snowpack. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County.
